# @esdmr/assert package
<!-- Do not edit this file. It is automatically generated by API Documenter. -->

[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@esdmr/assert](./esdmr.assert.md)


## Classes

|  Class | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [AssertionError](./esdmr.assert.assertionerror.md) | The error which is thrown by the <code>assert</code> function. |
|  [PrimitiveError](./esdmr.assert.primitiveerror.md) | Wrapper for any thrown value which is not an instance of Error. It converts those values to string via <code>String</code>. |
|  [WrappedError](./esdmr.assert.wrappederror.md) | Wrapper for any thrown value. It provides extra context to errors and assertions. Internally it uses [PrimitiveError](./esdmr.assert.primitiveerror.md) to wrap the original thrown value. |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [assert(condition, message, args)](./esdmr.assert.assert.md) | Asserts that a given condition is true. It formats the message provided with the arguments after that which are stringified via <code>String</code>. |
|  [isAnyInteger(value)](./esdmr.assert.isanyinteger.md) | Asserts that the given value is an integer. The integer may potentially be not safe. |
|  [isBigInt(value)](./esdmr.assert.isbigint.md) | Asserts that the given value is a big integer. |
|  [isBoolean(value)](./esdmr.assert.isboolean.md) | Asserts that the given value is a boolean. |
|  [isFinite\_2(value)](./esdmr.assert.isfinite_2.md) | Asserts that the given value is finite (Not <code>Â±Infinity</code> or <code>NaN</code>). |
|  [isFunction(value)](./esdmr.assert.isfunction.md) | Asserts that the given value is a function. |
|  [isNonNullable(value)](./esdmr.assert.isnonnullable.md) | Asserts that the given value is not <code>null</code> or <code>undefined</code>. |
|  [isNotNaN(value)](./esdmr.assert.isnotnan.md) | Asserts that the given value is not <code>NaN</code>. |
|  [isNotNull(value)](./esdmr.assert.isnotnull.md) | Asserts that the given value is not <code>null</code>. |
|  [isNotUndefined(value)](./esdmr.assert.isnotundefined.md) | Asserts that the given value is not <code>undefined</code>. |
|  [isNumber(value)](./esdmr.assert.isnumber.md) | Asserts that the given value is a number. |
|  [isObject(value)](./esdmr.assert.isobject.md) | Asserts that the given value is an object. The object may potentially be <code>null</code>. |
|  [isPositive(value)](./esdmr.assert.ispositive.md) | Asserts that the given value is positive. Negative zero is considered positive. |
|  [isSafeInteger(value)](./esdmr.assert.issafeinteger.md) | Asserts that the given value is a safe integer. |
|  [isString(value)](./esdmr.assert.isstring.md) | Asserts that the given value is a string. |
|  [isSymbol(value)](./esdmr.assert.issymbol.md) | Asserts that the given value is a symbol. |
